channel.title: News-Medical.Net Parkinsons Disease News Feed
channel.description: Latest Parkinsons Disease News and Research
channel.creator: News-Medical.Net

item.title: Novel bifunctional dimers show promise in preventing Parkinson's disease
item.description: A team of researchers from the University of Saskatchewan has developed two caffeine-based chemical compounds that show promise in preventing the ravages of Parkinson's disease.

item.title: Immunotherapy already in clinical trials for cancer could slow progression of Parkinson's disease
item.description: Researchers at Johns Hopkins report they have identified a protein that enables a toxic natural aggregate to spread from cell to cell in a mammal's brain — and a way to block that protein's action.

item.title: Study finds no evidence that exercise may lower woman’s risk of developing MS
item.description: A large, new study shows no evidence that exercise may reduce a woman's risk of developing multiple sclerosis (MS).

item.title: Increasing specific brain fats could be potential strategy for preventing epileptic seizures
item.description: Increasing the concentration of specific fats in the brain could suppress epileptic seizures. This is evident from ground-breaking research carried out by the research groups of Professor Patrik Verstreken and Professor Wim Versées.

item.title: Experimental drug may prevent development of multiple sclerosis in mice
item.description: The experimental drug laquinimod may prevent the development or reduce the progression of multiple sclerosis (MS) in mice, according to research published in the September 21, 2016, online issue of Neurology Neuroimmunology & Neuroinflammation, a medical journal of the American Academy of Neurology.

item.title: Enzyme deficiency in Krabbe's disease may point to new mechanisms underlying Parkinson's disease
item.description: A new article suggests that an enzyme deficiency seen in the lysosomal storage disorder Krabbe's disease may point to new mechanisms underlying certain late-onset neurodegenerative diseases such as Parkinson's disease.

item.title: Study provides deeper understanding of how cells' crowded surfaces induce complex protein behavior
item.description: Scientists at The Scripps Research Institute have brought physics and biology together to further understand how cells' crowded surfaces induce complex protein behavior.

item.title: Women, minorities less likely to receive stroke treatment, study finds
item.description: Women and minorities may be less likely to receive treatment for stroke, according to a study published in the September 14, 2016, online issue of Neurology®, the medical journal of the American Academy of Neurology.

item.title: Real-time MRI guidance could help target and deliver stem cell therapies
item.description: Working with animals, a team of scientists reports it has delivered stem cells to the brain with unprecedented precision by threading a catheter through an artery and infusing the cells under real-time MRI guidance.

item.title: International conference on longevity to be held in Brussels for 3 days
item.description: The Eurosymposium on Healthy Ageing is an international event that provides a unique opportunity for researchers, government officials, biotech executives, entrepreneurs, and non-governmental institutions from around the world to meet, network, and forge new scientific collaborations.
